results.title: Night Moves
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Robert Sherman and Arthur Penn
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman plays private detective Harry Moseby who is hired by an ex- actress to find her teenage runaway daughter. Moseby’s hunt for the missing teenager takes him deep into mystery, double-cross, violence and smuggling. A homage to film-noir, “Night Moves” is also a bleak, stylish examination of alienation and greed in contemporary America.

results.title: Night falls on Manhattan
results.creator_credit: Spelling Films, Thom Mount, Josh Kramer and Sidney Lumet
results.brief_description: Sean Casey (Andy Garcia), a cop turned lawyer is landed the coveted position of D.A. when he wins a highly publicised case that resulted in the death of 3 police officers and the serious wounding of Casey’s father, also a policeman. The case is marked by dirty cops and corruption and as Casey begins his new appointment he discovers that truth was not really the victor during the trail, but was justice and honesty served? Casey must decide on a balance between the confusing concepts of truth, honesty, justice, loyalty and morality. Based on the novel, “Tainted evidence” by Robert Daley. Cast also includes Ian Holm, Lena Olin and Paul Guilfoyle.

results.title: Nico the unicorn
results.creator_credit: Fries/Schultz Film Group, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures, Pieter Kroonenburg, Julie Allan and Graeme Campbell
results.brief_description: Based on the popular novel for young adults by Frank Sacks, this drama centres on the adventures of Billy (Kevin Zegers), an 11-year-old boy whose life is shattered after his leg is permanently damaged, and his father is killed, in a car accident involving a drunk driver. Attempting to escape the bad memories of the accident, Billy and his mother Julie (Anne Archer) move to a new town, where, after visiting a rundown circus, they adopt a neglected pregnant pony that is being mistreated by its owner. But this is no ordinary pony. The foal she gives birth is a unicorn with magical powers who transforms Billy’s life. Yet as word spreads about this wonderous animal, Billy is forced muster all his courage to take the steps needed to save it from destruction.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fries/Schultz Film Group, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures, Pieter Kroonenburg, Julie Allan and Graeme Campbell

results.title: Nicholas and Alexandra
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Horizon (US), Horizon (GB), Sam Spiegel and Franklin J. Schaffner
results.brief_description: A dazzling cast, with Michael Jayston and Janet Suzman playing the lead roles of the ill-fated Czar Nicholas II, and the Czarina Alexandra. Born to be one of the world’s most powerful men, Nicholas ruled millions of people with an empire stretching over one-sixth of the globe. His belief in the Divine Right to rule, made him oblivious to the hardships endured by many of his subjects who were ready to embrace the powerful ideals proposed by Lenin and his followers. The Czarina, in a desperate bid to find a cure for their haemophiliac son, relies heavily on the seductive and mysterious “Mad Monk” Rasputin. Once Lenin and his Bolsheviks gain power, the Royal Family is doomed. “Nicholas and Alexandra” is filled with the pomp and pageantry of history’s great events.

results.title: Niagara
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Charles Brackett and Henry Hathaway
results.brief_description: Nicknamed by film critic Dave Kehr - “Henry Hathaway’s hypnotic contemplation of two American monuments, Niagara Falls and Marilyn Monroe”, ‘Niagara’ is a classic tale of adultery with an added Freudian touch. While on a belated honeymoon at Niagara Falls, Polly and Ray Cutler (Jean Peters and Casey Adams) make the acquaintance of Rose (Marilyn Monroe) and her much older husband George Loomis (Joseph Cotten), and through their neighboring cottages the Cutlers become aware that all is not well with the Loomises. Rose is constantly flaunting her sexuality and flirting with strangers, thus causing her husband to erupt in uncontrollable accesses of rage. In the shadow lurks Rose’s lover Patrick (Richard Allan), waiting for an opportunity to kill George and make it look like a jealousy-induced suicide. Although often associated with exotic locales, Hathaway made the most of the claustrophobic motel setting and gave Marilyn Monroe a chance to explore her dramatic talents. The film was shot in Technicolor, but has roots in the great Film Noir tradition, while The Falls provide more than a spectacular backdrop for a conventional romantic honeymoon and provide a visual metaphor for the destructive effect of sexual passion. The film was scripted and produced by Billy Wilder’s regular collaborator Charles Brackett. Cast also includes Jean Peters and Don Wilson. Includes the original theatrical trailer.

results.brief_description: A young woman inherits an old people’s home and finds that its inmates are becoming the victims of a mad killer.

results.title: New York stories
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Jack Rollins, Charles H. Joffe, Fred Roos, Fred Fuchs, Robert Greenhut, Martin Scorsese, Francis Ford Coppola and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: A wildly diverse, star-studded trilogy about life in New York. “Life lessons”, directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Nick Nolte and Rosanna Arquette is a passionate tale of a world-famous painter torn between his passion for his art and his infatuation with his unresponsive assistant. “Life without Zoe”, directed by Coppola, stars Talia Shire and Giancarlo Giannini in a whimsical fantasy about childlike parents and a very grown-up daughter. Original music by Carmine Coppola. “Oedipus wrecks” has Woody Allen directing and starring in a comedy about a neurotic lawyer who cannot escape the woman who literally looms largest in his life - his mother. Also stars Mia Farrow, Mae Questal and Julie Kavner.

results.title: New Jack City
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Doug McHenry, George Jackson and Mario Van Peebles
results.brief_description: This gangster movie for the 90’s has a hard hitting anti drug message, and an enigmatic villain in Nino Brown (Wesley Snipes), a seemingly untouchable drug baron. Brown is a self made man, an entrepreneurial success - the only problem is, he’s made his money from crack. He also has a curious sense of communal loyalty, sharing his wealth with the community around him (and who love him for this generosity), despite supplying a substance that kills. Hot on his tail are the angels, 2 unconventional police officers Scotty and Nick (Ice-T, Judd Nelson) who will stop at nothing to rid the New York City streets of Nino Brown’s power. Brown has converted an abandoned Harlem apartment building into an impenetrable fortress which houses his gang, the Cash Money Brothers. This building must be infiltrated and the only way to do it is to send someone in undercover. Initially they send an ex drug addict (Chris Rock), but when he is unsuccessful, it’s left to Scotty to play the part of a drug dealer and make his way to Nino Brown himself. Cast also includes Vanessa Williams.

results.title: Never cry wolf
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Lewis Allen, Jack Couffer, Joseph Strick and Carroll Ballard
results.brief_description: In the Arctic region wolves are suspected of contributing to the diminishing number of caribou herds. “The Lupine project” is established by the government to investigate and observe wolves to provide concrete evidence of their aggressive nature. A young biologist, Tyler (Charles Martin Tyler), is left alone in the unfriendly Arctic wilderness to conduct such a study where he must contend with the forces of nature to discover as much as he can about the canis lupis; the wolf. Based on Farley Mowat’s autobiographical novel of the same name, screenplay by Curtis Hanson. Also starring Brian Dennehy.

results.title: Never been kissed [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bushwood Pictures, Flower Films, Fox 2000 Pictures, Sandy Isaac, Nancy Juvonen and Raja Gosnell
results.brief_description: In this romantic comedy Drew Barrymore plays Josie Geller, a nerdy self conscious (and at times self-loathing) twenty-five year old who harbours dreams of being swept off her feet by a prince, and falling in love for keeps. In reality she is perennially single and works for a newspaper as a copy editor whilst fostering ambitions to be a reporter. Part of Josie’s dream is realised when she is sent on an undercover assignment - back to high school. Unfortunately for Josie this means a return to the lion’s den - throughout her adolescence Josie was mocked mercilessly and once undercover she soon finds herself drawn back into the nerdy circles in which she is most comfortable. But when her editor demands that she joins the cool group Josie must transform herself or lose the assignment. Much of the humour in this film is quite black - the flashbacks (as well as those scenes in the present) when Josie is humiliated, are quite excruciating to watch. But the many sly intentions of the script are undermined by saccharine overtones that swamp the film. Barrymore however displays a deft talent for comedy, essentially carrying the film, playing a very sympathetic and quite believable teen and young adult.
